nl.inl.blacklab.forwardindex

Class ForwardIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.forwardindex.ForwardIndex

  • public abstract class ForwardIndex
extends java.lang.Object
    A component that can quickly tell you what word occurs at a specific position of a specific document.

      • setIdTranslateInfo

        public abstract void setIdTranslateInfo(org.apache.lucene.index.DirectoryReader reader,
                      java.lang.String lucenePropFieldName)
        Indicate how to translate Lucene document ids to forward index ids (by looking them up in the index). Caches the forward index id field.
        Parameters:
        reader - the index
        lucenePropFieldName - the forward index if field

      • luceneDocIdToFiid

        Returns:
        the forward index id

      • warmUp

        public abstract void warmUp()
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Perform a series of reads on the forward index to get (most of) it into disk cache.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread was interrupted during this operation

      • close

        public abstract void close()
        Close the forward index. Writes the table of contents to disk if modified.

      • addDocument

        public abstract int addDocument(java.util.List<java.lang.String> content,
              java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> posIncr)
        Store the given content and assign an id to it. Note that if more than one token occurs at any position, we only store the first in the forward index.
        Parameters:
        content - the content to store
        posIncr - the associated position increments, or null if position increment is always 1.
        Returns:
        the id assigned to the content

      • addDocument

        public abstract int addDocument(java.util.List<java.lang.String> content)
        Store the given content and assign an id to it
        Parameters:
        content - the content to store
        Returns:
        the id assigned to the content

      • deleteDocument

        public abstract void deleteDocument(int fiid)
        Delete a document from the forward index
        Parameters:
        fiid - id of the document to delete

      • retrieveParts

        @Deprecated
public abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> retrieveParts(int fiid,
                                                          int[] start,
                                                          int[] end)
        Deprecated. use retrievePartsInt and getTerms().get(id)
        Retrieve one or more substrings from the specified content. This is more efficient than retrieving the whole content, or retrieving parts in separate calls, because the file is only opened once and random access is used to read only the required parts. NOTE: if offset and length are both -1, retrieves the whole content. This is used by the retrieve(id) method. NOTE2: Mapped file IO on Windows has some issues that sometimes cause an OutOfMemoryError on the FileChannel.map() call (which makes no sense, because memory mapping only uses address space, it doesn't try to read the whole file). Possibly this could be solved by using 64-bit Java, but we haven't tried. For now we just disable memory mapping on Windows.
        Parameters:
        fiid - forward index document id
        start - the starting points of the substrings (in words)
        end - the end points (i.e. first token beyond) of the substrings (in words)
        Returns:
        the parts

      • retrievePartsSortOrder

        @Deprecated
public abstract java.util.List<int[]> retrievePartsSortOrder(int fiid,
                                                      int[] start,
                                                      int[] end,
                                                      boolean sensitive)
        Deprecated. 
        Retrieve one or more parts from the specified content, in the form of token sort order ids. This is more efficient than retrieving the whole content, or retrieving parts in separate calls, because the file is only opened once and random access is used to read only the required parts.
        Parameters:
        fiid - forward index document id
        start - the starting points of the parts to retrieve (in words)
        end - the end points (i.e. first token beyond) of the parts to retrieve (in words)
        sensitive - whether to get the case-sensitive sort order or not
        Returns:
        the parts

      • retrievePartsInt

        public abstract java.util.List<int[]> retrievePartsInt(int fiid,
                                     int[] start,
                                     int[] end)
        Retrieve one or more parts from the specified content, in the form of token ids. This is more efficient than retrieving the whole content, or retrieving parts in separate calls, because the file is only opened once and random access is used to read only the required parts. NOTE: if offset and length are both -1, retrieves the whole content. This is used by the retrieve(id) method. NOTE2: Mapped file IO on Windows has some issues that sometimes cause an OutOfMemoryError on the FileChannel.map() call (which makes no sense, because memory mapping only uses address space, it doesn't try to read the whole file). Possibly this could be solved by using 64-bit Java, but we haven't tried. For now we just disable memory mapping on Windows.
        Parameters:
        fiid - forward index document id
        start - the starting points of the parts to retrieve (in words)
        end - the end points (i.e. first token beyond) of the parts to retrieve (in words)
        Returns:
        the parts

        public abstract Terms getTerms()
        Get the Terms object in order to translate ids to token strings

        Returns:

      • open

        public static ForwardIndex open(java.io.File dir)
        Open a forward index. Automatically figures out the forward index version and instantiates the right class.
        Parameters:
        dir - forward index directory
        Returns:
        the forward index object

      • open

        public static ForwardIndex open(java.io.File dir,
                boolean indexMode)
        Open a forward index. Automatically figures out the forward index version and instantiates the right class.
        Parameters:
        dir - forward index directory
        indexMode - true iff we're in index mode (writing to the forward index); otherwise it will be read-only.
        Returns:
        the forward index object

      • open

        public static ForwardIndex open(java.io.File dir,
                boolean indexMode,
                java.text.Collator collator,
                boolean create)
        Open a forward index. Automatically figures out the forward index version and instantiates the right class.
        Parameters:
        dir - forward index directory
        indexMode - true iff we're in index mode (writing to the forward index); otherwise it will be read-only.
        collator - collator to use for sorting
        create - if true, create a new forward index
        Returns:
        the forward index object

      • setKeepInMemory

        @Deprecated
public static void setKeepInMemory(boolean b)
        Deprecated. keeping forward index in memory is 'never' a good idea (better to use OS caching)
        Parameters:
        b - true iff we want to keep FI in memory

      • setKeepInMemory

        @Deprecated
public static void setKeepInMemory(boolean keepInMemory,
                              long keepFree)
        Deprecated. keeping forward index in memory is 'never' a good idea (better to use OS caching)
        Sets the options for keeping forward indices in memory. Default and recommended setting is false, as it takes advantage of OS caching.
        Parameters:
        keepInMemory - if true, tries to keep the forward index in memory
        keepFree - how much of the maximum heap to keep free (only used if keepInMemory == true)
